page.title: 11SHOPPING
page.content: There are two shops in Walesby, one is the village Post Office and general store, the second is a former Co-op store closed in the early 1980's that has now been re-opened as a general store. Both these shops have licenses to sell alcohol. Although these two premises will provide for the immediate needs of the villagers a survey carried out recently showed that families travel to large supermarkets for their regular shopping trips, making these journeys to places such as Mansfield, Ollerton and Retford, usually on a weekly or monthly basis. The village of Kirton has no shop at all, the former village Post Office having closed recently. Both villages also have regular visits from mobile shops such as the butcher.
